# Scale: Melodic in D (Mode: Locrian #2, Shape: G)

## Brief Presentation
The Melodic scale is a seven-note scale that is derived from the Diatonic major scale. This specific scale is the Melodic scale in D, played in the Locrian #2 mode, using the G shape. It has a unique sound due to its mode and shape variations, creating a distinctive melodic flavor.

## Notes and Intervals
The Melodic scale in D, Locrian #2 mode, using the G shape consists of the following notes and intervals:
- D (Root)
- E (Major 2nd)
- F (Minor 3rd)
- G (Perfect 4th)
- A (Perfect 5th)
- B (Minor 6th)
- C (Minor 7th)

## Genre and Musical Flavor
The Melodic scale in D, played in the Locrian #2 mode with the G shape, is often found in jazz, fusion, and experimental genres. It adds a sense of tension and dissonance due to the Locrian mode combined with the unique shape, creating an edgy and intriguing musical flavor.
